cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles ENE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, forecast to turn northeast and pass near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks, then accelerate northeastward away from the U.S. Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the Outer Banks, North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City to Duck, NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. and Mid-Atlantic coasts, especially coastal North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤2%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with gusts 20–30 kt possible Monday night–Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Delaware River/Upper Delaware Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible Monday night–Tuesday; totals generally <1 inch
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated swells in nearby Atlantic and Delaware Bay could hamper pilot transfers and small-craft movements
